newsitem.title: USA: ComEd fully shuts Dresden 3 Ill. nuke.
newsitem.headline: ComEd fully shuts Dresden 3 Ill. nuke.

text.p: Commonwealth Edison Co (ComEd) fully shut its 794 megawatt (MW) Dresden 3 nuclear power plant for maintenance, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) reported Monday.
The unit was taken off line Saturday and put in hot shutdown, which typically indicates a brief outage.
The unit had been operating at 77 percent of its rated capacity on Friday, the NRC reported.
No details of the outage were immediately available. The unit's next scheduled refuelling outage is set for March, 1997.
The neighboring Dresden 2 nuclear unit was operating near its 794 MW capacity.
ComEd is a subsidiary of Unicom Corp.
